etymology.description: semantic: 手(手) (shǒu, "hand") + phonetic: 奄(奄) (yān, "to cover") = hand-related tool -> handcuff
etymology.interpretation: The character 㚔 combines the semantic element 手(手) (shǒu, "hand") indicating a hand-related object, with the phonetic element 奄(奄) (yān, "to cover"), suggesting the action of covering or enclosing the hands, much like a handcuff.

examples.chinese: 警察在抓捕嫌疑人时(警察在抓捕嫌疑人時)，用㚔将其扣住(用㚔將其扣住)。
examples.pinyin: Jǐngchá zài zhuābǔ xiányírén shí, yòng yì jiāng qí kòuzhù。
examples.english: When arresting the suspect, the police used a handcuff to restrain him.

examples.chinese: 在审讯室内(在審訊室內)，嫌疑人被警察用㚔固定双手(嫌疑人被警察用㚔固定雙手)。
examples.pinyin: Zài shěnxùn shìnèi, xiányírén bèi jǐngchá yòng yì gùdìng shuāngshǒu。
examples.english: Inside the interrogation room, the suspect was restrained by the police with handcuffs.
